problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous video clip.
Which of the following statements are true, regarding quantum operations, and quantum measurements (specifically, complete positive operator-valued measures, otherwise known as POVMs)?

choice.text: If [mathjaxinline]\{ E_ k\}[/mathjaxinline] are the Kraus operators for a quantum operation, then [mathjaxinline]M_ k = E_ k^\dagger E_ k[/mathjaxinline] are well-defined corresponding POVM operators.
If [mathjaxinline]\{ E_ k\}[/mathjaxinline] are the Kraus operators for a quantum operation, then [mathjaxinline]M_ k = E_ k[/mathjaxinline] are well-defined corresponding POVM operators.
If [mathjaxinline]\{ M_ k\}[/mathjaxinline] are well-defined POVM operators, then [mathjaxinline]\sum _ k M_ k^\dagger M_ k = I[/mathjaxinline].
If [mathjaxinline]\{ M_ k\}[/mathjaxinline] are well-defined POVM operators, then [mathjaxinline]\sum _ k M_ k = I[/mathjaxinline].
